docs.title: Triple-N Dataset Documentation
docs.text:
Non-human Primate Neural Responses to Natural Scenes

Ref: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2025.05.06.652408v1

Contact: moonl@pku.edu.cn Corresponding: pbao@pku.edu.cn

This document is currently under development to ensure clarity and ease of understanding. Your feedback is invaluable—please feel free to raise an issue or email me with any suggestions or points needing clarification.

docs.title: script
docs.text: code for analyze and generate figures in the paper

docs.title: demo code
docs.text: not related to paper, just a going-through demo - demo1, generating single unit raster plot for several images - demo2, generating populational preference of interested ROI

docs.title: ROI Definition File: exclude_area.xls
docs.text:
Contains manually defined Regions of Interest (ROIs) for each session.

  • One row = one ROI
  • Single session may contain multiple ROIs (e.g., session 11 has object area at tip + unknown areas)

docs.title: File Columns
docs.text: Column Description Example Values SesIdx Session number 11, 12, 13... y1 ROI start position (shank coordinate) 1200 (μm) y2 ROI end position (shank coordinate) 1800 (μm) arealabel Area Label See full list below, with number corresponding to subject idx ROIIndex ROI identifier Links to 3D coordinates in another file

docs.title: Area Label Key
docs.text:
Body Face Object: - MB: Middle body (MSB) - AB: Anterior body (ASB) - MF: Middle face (ML) - AF: Anterior face (AL) - MO: Middle object (MLO) - MO1s1 and MO1s2 correspond 2 subregions of MO1 - AO: Anterior object (ALO)

Other Areas: - LPP: Lateral place patch - PITP: Posterior inferotemporal place patch - CLC: Central lateral color area - AMC: Anterior medial color area

docs.text: code for analyze and generate figures in the paper

docs.title: Behavioral Control
docs.text: We use MonkeyLogic for behavioral control: MonkeyLogic website

docs.title: File Structure
docs.text: For each recording session, three file types are provided:

docs.title: 1. GoodUnit Files
docs.text:
Contains processed spike information and some meta-data.

Example Filename: GoodUnit_240629_JianJian_NSD1000_LOC_g2.mat

docs.title: Key File Contents
docs.text: Component Description global_params.pre_onset Time (ms) prior to stimuli onset (here: 50) global_params.post_onset Time (ms) after stimuli onset (here: 400) global_params.PsthRange Time points for raster and PSTH below Here: -50:1:400 meta_data Recording metadata and processed behavior meta_data.trial_valid_idx Stimuli indices for each trial - 0: failed trial - 1-1000: NSD Shared 1000 - 1001-1072: Localizer stimuli GoodUnitStrc Organized sturcture for each units

docs.title: GoodUnitStrc Structure Key Field
docs.text:
Field Format Description Raster [trial_idx × time_point] Spike raster matrix typically 0 1, where 1 is one spike could be 2 or lager for some MUA response_matrix_img [image_idx × time_point] PSTH matrix with a 20ms box bin qm [1 × n_metric] Quality metric from BombCell spiketime_ms [1 × n_spikes] Spike train time point relative to stimuli train waveform [7 Chan × 61 Sample] Spike waveform

note: trial_idx here correspond to all valid trials (i.e. meta_data.trial_valid_idx(meta_data.trial_valid_idx~=0))

docs.title: 2. H5 Files
docs.text:
Better format for faster data access relative to matlab GoodUnitStrc. Fetch with matlab:

    h5read('xxx', '/field')

Example Filename: ses01_240629_M1_2.h5

docs.title: Contents
docs.text: Field Format Description raster_matrix_img [unit_num × trial_idx × time_point] Same as GoodUnitStrc response_matrix_img [unit_num × image_idx × time_point] Same as GoodUnitStrc

docs.title: Key Variables
docs.text: Variable Format Description B_SI, F_SI, O_SI [1 × unit_num] d-prime for body, face, object categories from localizer best_t_time [1 × unit_num] Time window with highest reliability mean_psth [unit_num × time_point] Averaged PSTH across images pos [1 × unit_num] Spike position along the Electrode shank reliability_basic/best [1 × unit_num] Split-half reliability - basic: calculated from fixed time window - best: calculated from best time window response_basic/best [unit_num × 1072] Averaged firing rates - basic: calculated from fixed time window - best: calculated from best time window snr, snr_max [1 × unit_num] Signal-to-noise ratios - max: calculated by most preferred stimuli UnitType [1 × unit_num] Unit type from BombCell: 1: Single Unit2: MUA3-4: Non-somatic
